 We are looking for a highly experienced pipeline engineer to design and develop a variety of pipeline systems for our clients. In this role, you will design new pipelines, install and construct pipe infrastructure, and perform maintenance and repairs to existing pipelines.
   

  

 To be a successful pipeline engineer, you should be mathematically minded and highly accurate in your work. Skilled pipeline engineers should possess excellent analytical thinking and problem\\-solving abilities.
   

  

**Pipeline Engineer Responsibilities**
* Meeting with clients to define pipeline requirements.
* Conducting site surveys and research to determine pipeline specifications and placement as well as pump sizes.
* Preparing and presenting technical materials such as cost estimates, pipeline layouts, and flow simulations.
* Calculating project requirements such as materials, budget, and time.
* Creating and developing digital designs such as pipeline maps, blueprints, and mechanical diagrams.
* Overseeing the construction and installation process of pipeline infrastructure and systems.
* Managing the project workflow and budget.
* Performing quality control assessments and ensuring that the pipelines comply with all technical and safety regulations.
* Performing maintenance, repairs, and upgrades to pipelines, as needed.
* Keeping up to date with the latest advancements in design software, technical standards, and construction techniques.


**Pipeline Engineer Requirements**
* Bachelor's degree in civil, mechanical, or structural engineering.
* Professional Engineer (P.E.) license.
* A minimum of four years of experience as a pipeline engineer or similar.
* Proficiency in mechanical design software such as AutoCAD and Pipeline Studio.
* Excellent knowledge of PHSMA regulations.
* Experience with pipeline construction techniques such as welding, excavation, and assembly.
* Exceptional project management and organizational skills.
* Strong communication and leadership abilities.
* Willingness to travel and work in harsh weather conditions.


 This job is provided by Shine.com

title: Structural Health Monitoring (SHM) Expert
description:
**Company Description** 




  






 TPF Engineering Pvt. Ltd. is a civil engineering consultancy firm specializing in infrastructure design and consultancy. With over 55 years of experience, we provide sustainable infrastructure advisory services to our clients. Our goal is to become the leading engineering consultant in the market and be recognized for our excellence. We are a subsidiary of TPF S.A., a Belgian multi\\-national organization with over 4000 collaborators operating in 44 countries worldwide.
 




  




* **Name of the Position :** 

 Structural Health Monitoring (SHM) Expert (Full time position)
* **Location :** 

 Vashi ,Navi Mumbai



  





**Role Description and Qualifications:** 




  





**To perform this role successfully, the individual will be responsible for, but not limited to, the following:** 




**The Structural Health Monitoring (SHM) will be responsible for overseeing the installation, maintenance, and data analysis of SHM systems on various structures. This role involves working closely with project teams to ensure the effective monitoring of structural integrity, assessing the performance of instrumentation, and providing technical support to ensure the safety and longevity of infrastructure project.** 




  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* **Design and Implementation:** 
 Develop and implement SHM systems for various infrastructure projects. Oversee the installation and calibration of sensors and instrumentation on structures.
* **Data Collection and Analysis:** 
 Monitor and analyse data collected from SHM systems to assess structural health. Utilize software tools to interpret data and generate reports on structural performance.
* **Maintenance and Troubleshooting:** 
 Conduct regular inspections and maintenance of SHM equipment to ensure proper functioning. Troubleshoot and resolve any issues related to instrumentation and data collection.
* **Collaboration and Communication:** 
 Work with multidisciplinary teams, including engineers, contractors, and project managers, to integrate SHM systems into projects. Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders through detailed reports and presentations.
* **Compliance and Standards** 
 : Ensure all SHM activities comply with relevant industry standards and regulations. Stay updated with the latest advancements in SHM technology and best practices.
* **Project Management** 
 : Assist in planning and managing SHM projects, including budgeting, scheduling, and resource allocation. Provide technical support during the design and construction phases of projects.



  





**Criteria :** 



* **Education:** 
 Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, or a related field. Master‚Äôs degree in a related field is a plus.
* **Experience:** 
 3\\-5 years of experience in structural health monitoring, instrumentation, or a related field. Hands\\-on experience with SHM systems, including sensor installation, data collection, and analysis.
* **Technical Skills** 
 : Proficiency in SHM software and data analysis tools (e.g., MATLAB, LabVIEW, or similar). Familiarity with various types of sensors and instrumentation used in SHM, such as strain gauges, accelerometers, and displacement sensors. Understanding of signal processing and data interpretation techniques.
* **Certifications:** 
 Certification in structural health monitoring or a related field is preferred.
 
 Professional Engineer (PE) license or equivalent is a plus.
* **Other Requirements:** 
 Willingness to travel to project sites as needed.
 
 Ability to work in various environmental conditions, including construction sites.
